reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: I booked the basic room and they upgraded us to a 2 bedroom 2 bathroom townhouse with a fireplace. It was really nice. The unit had a bathroom downstairs with a shower, murphy bed, fireplace and It also had a safe, microwave and small refrigerator. The upstairs has no door. It is open and had a king bed with another bathroom with a tub. They do have covered free parking, heated swimming pool and jacuzzi. It is a very nice property. It is across the street from a outdoor mall. The mall had a PF Chang's, California Pizza, Sushi restaurant, Subway, Cold Stone, Whole Foods Market. We at at PF Chang's and the Sushi restaurant. They had 50% sushi. It was great food. I think it was called Kumma Sushi, but not for sure. We did walk there from the hotel.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel did have breakfast included. It was continental breakfast. They had danish, bagels, muffins, oatmeal, fruit, coffee, juice, cereals. We would stay again.
reviews.title: Very good hotel/motel in Monterey

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We are from Germany. During our roundtrip through California we have been in many motels. This was the best one. We slept in a standard room. The room was clean and verry nice renewed as well as the entire motel. The continental breakfast was good. The motel has also a very good pool area with a big heated pool and a spa. The pool area is also clean and renewed. The rate for the room was also very good as well as the service. Staff is very friendy. They have a contract with a fitness center 4 miles away. Guests can use the fitness center for free. The fitness machines are new. A car is required to get there. However to use the fitness center is very good option that we used.
reviews.title: Beautiful, yet small rooms.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the mariposa early july. We came in for my step daughters graduation from highschool. I was looking for a very nice, clean, quiet hotel because that would have been myself and my husbands first time without our 7y/o and 17 month old. I was shocked by how nice and detailed the room was to be so small. I loved the bathroom mirror so much in fact im searching for it as we speak. The only downside to the room was that the bed squeaked to muck for a young married couple to have enjoyed.
reviews.title: great find across from DelMonte Shopping Center

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Nice upscale choice of accomodations that offers great service, jacuzzi in the suite- - fireplace, large screen TV, bathroom amenities wonderful by SPA..and a great breakfast buffet included with outside sunny patio starting your day off right. Free PArking and nice 15 moin walk to Fishermans Wharf/DTWN Monterey or across the stree from first class shopping.. easy access to Carmel. GM Joy is personable and great cartetaker.
reviews.title: thoroughly pleased

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel for one night in early August for a quick vacation to Monterey. We booked the townhouse suite which was pretty neat since it has an upstairs and a downstairs room. The kids really enjoyed running up and down the stairs and they loved the Murphy bed downstairs. Hubby and I appreciated the 2 bathrooms. Everything was clean. It was nice to have 2 tvs too. The check out time is 11am and check in is 3pm.
reviews.title: Good stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013
reviews.text: The hotel is nothing spectacular. It seems like all the hotels in Monterey are 3 star places that can charge high prices because of the location. It was nice to have free, covered parking. The breakfast was good. There was waffles, oatmeal, yogurt, pastries, and fruit and the usual drinks, coffee, tea, milk, juices. The room was very small though, so we took our food up to our room.
reviews.title: Okay for a night.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is traffic noise because the property seems to be on the corner of two streets and there was a fair amount of traffic and you could hear it all the time.
reviews.title: Great value, some frills.
Awesome value
reviews.text: This place was good for a short stay. Not sure if I would stay here next time, but it was nice to try it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from a two-week vacation to California. This is one hotel where I feel that TripAdvisor let me down. Echoing previous reviewers, the hotel had a "shabby" feeling from the time we pulled up. So much so, that I pulled out my phone while waiting to check in and checked TripAdvisor to be sure that I hadn't booked it by mistake. The hotel has been renovated, but it seems they put new furnishings in an old building and forgot to update the rest. Fortunately, the small rooms and bedding appeared to be clean (else we wouldn't have stayed). But the place could definitely use some TLC. The hooks on our bathroom door were broken off, our room and hallway smelled of heavily-perfumed air freshener (leaving me to wonder what it was covering up) and the pool deck was covered in bird poop (see photo). I wouldn't let the kids swim in the pool. In summary, the Mariposa Inn was fine for a night, but I couldn't recommend or return.
reviews.title: really nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011
reviews.text: Lovely hotel in Monterey. Very clean modern rooms with lovely beds and bed linen. More like a motel than a hotel but nice decor. The rooms have safes, ionic hair dryers, irons, lovely dressing gowns, free wi fi and a fridge.
reviews.title: Great Boutique Hotel
Let Down
reviews.text: There was a pool although we didnt use it. Breakfast was included in the price and was excellent pastries bagels toast fruit juices tea and coffees.

reviews.title: We loved the hotel, the room and the service.
reviews.text: You would need a car as hotel is at the top end of the town.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Their website photos looked great, and we were excited until we pulled into the parking lot. This hotel was actually a motel. It wasn't quite the level of Motel 6...I'd say Motel 9. The rooms had been updated, but ours was tiny. We didn't have a fireplace like we had hoped. I have high standards for hotels, but I'd rate this one as a 2.5 star stay and wished I would have spent $100 more per night for a really nice place. About the only good thing was the proximity to hwy 1, and we were able to drive to downtown Monterey or downtown Carmel in a matter of minutes.
reviews.title: Great Hospitality! We will be back.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I highly recommend this hotel and especially the room with the jacuzzi. The room was decorated in beautiful and new looking modern furniture. Everyone at the hotel was delightful to deal with, so friendly and helpful. Whatever minor problems there were, were taken care of immediately. As a matter of fact, we extended our stay by 2 days because we enjoyed the Inn so much. When we go back to the Monterey/Carmel area, we will definitely stay at the Mariposa Inn again.
reviews.title: 4th of July Anniversary weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: We loved this hotel. Great value! The room is very nicely appointed and the staff was very friendly. There were robes, a microwave, fireplace and a refrigerator. There was also complimentary water. It was the best inclusive continental breakfast I've had (fresh and "real" croissants, muffins, cereals, waffles, dried and fresh fruit...) There is a terrific fire pit with comfy seating at night too. The staff was very attentive at keeping the area clean, but there was a tip jar. Didn't have a chance to try the pool, which seemed nice but small. We only had a few complaints...The bathroom we had was so small that the door kept bumping into the toilet. There was a light coming through some glass cubes that was annoying in the morning. The parking was tight. The entrance to the hotel parking lot can be easily missed. I would definitely recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Great little hotel!!
Modern room, free access to an actual gym
reviews.text: When we arrived to the Mariposa Inn I was a bit disappointed, it looked a bit shabby on the outside. However, when we got to our room it was a relief, it was modern and clean. The woman at the reception was beyond helpful, she recommended an restaurant at the mall, something I doubt we would have picked ourselves, and the food turned out to be great! The mall is right across the street, so if you want to go shopping, it is rather conveniently located. The breakfast was a rather basic one with some toast, pastries and yogurt, but one thing I really loved was that the price included free access to a gym in Monterey. This might sound like an odd thing to be happy about, but we were travelling for 4 weeks and the gyms at the hotels are usually not that well equipped, so this was a definite bonus for us!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013
reviews.text: The apartments have a good location- 5 mins drive from Cannery Row and all the Monterey sights. A handy mall across the road. Gas station 2 mins up the road. On arrival a bridal party were bombing around in the car park with music blasting out. Worrying first impression. Our room (101) terrible location. Noisy from the road and the room next door who kept going in and out to car outside rooms banging doors and shouting. When checking in I requested a quiet room but was told that the place and roads are dead after 7.00pm and so room would be fine. Erm no. Got no sleep at all. When checking out, I said we didn't enjoy our stay because of the noise and the man just said 'yes, that is a noisy room!' Customer service nil. Room very clean and complimentary water was the best thing about it. Complimentary breakfast good but a small room which might get busy. Very disappointed overall. The place is nothing like the online pictures. Expect a basic motel feel with a few undesirables hanging around the car park. Not recommended.
reviews.title: Best thing was the complimentary water

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: The Mariposa is just one in a long street of motels of varying qualities, but it is easy to see why it gets good guest reviews, and certainly the accommodation worked perfectly for us (family of 4). The layout of the Town House suite was perfect, as the children were downstairs and us parents upstairs (with resident seagull outside the window who spent most of the day peering in at us!), with 2 bathrooms between us. As soon as we arrived, after a long drive up Big Sur, the children and my husband unwound in the pool - very much appreciated. Pool towels provided!
reviews.title: Worked well for us
Building exteriors were a little tired but v clean room & helpful reception staff
reviews.text: To get anywhere in Monterey, we had to go by car, but it is a small city and signage is excellent so this never caused us a problem. In fact, on the second night, having had a full and active day at the Aquarium and then sea kayaking, we couldn't be bothered to go downtown again so we appreciated being able to walk across the road to the shopping centre and have a meal there.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: We really enjoyed our stay at the Mariposa Inn. The staff was very friendly. The room was small but clean and remodeled. The king sized bed was very comfortable, and the bedding was very nice. We had a sky light in our room which was fun. The Mariposa was close to the freeway and only about 3 minutes from the start of 17 Mile Drive. We could hear some traffic, but the accommodations overcame the negative. The hot tub was very nice. Our favorite part was the breakfast. The dining area is small, but we were able to find seating easily, and there is additional seating outside. There were waffles, cereal, granola, yogurt, bagels and fruit. It was a much better breakfast than we had been having at a chain hotel for the last 3 days. The pastries were actually from a bakery and were delicious. We had a wonderful stay at the Mariposa and would recommend it to anyone and would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We staye at the Mariposa Inn and Suites for one night in July 2013 and it was ok. Not great, but not bad.
reviews.title: Ok for a night!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pros:
reviews.title: Be Careful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -free wifi in rooms
reviews.title: Loved our room!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: -continental breakfast included in room price
reviews.title: Very Nice but

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Small boutique Inn and suites was recommended by the local Information centre. Great service clean room nice breakfast. Will stay here again was very central to attractions and across the road from Del Monte shopping plaza.
reviews.title: Down in Montery

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel located a short drive from central Monterey. Shopping mall with a large department store and some other smaller stores and eateries located on the other side of the street which was very convenient.
reviews.title: Great room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: Spent one night in an "Executive suite" at this hotel.
reviews.title: Used to be better, but still okay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our suite was very large. Bedroom area with desk, TV and fire place and a small livingroom area with its own TV, microwave, fridge safe and a couch. Very stylish above average size bathroom with bathtub. This is one of the better hotel rooms I have stayd in. Bathrobes are supplied in the room, these are great when getting to and from the pool and hot tub.
reviews.title: Breakfast staff awful, otherwise very good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Good parking. WiFi worked great. Breakfast was OK typical american but not enough seating in the breakfast room.
reviews.title: Stumbled on a gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived late afternoon on the 27th of May and to my surprise, this room has no
reviews.title: Not that great of a place to stay in Monterey, Don't plan on sleeping in!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: air conditioning! While the weather was fantastic, the room was stuffy and the only air was either opening the window or using the fan that is supplied in the room. We were not comfortable leaving the window open so just had to stick it out. The rooms look wonderful online, however ours was small and there was a large skylight right in the center of the ceiling so as soon as the sun comes up, you have daylight in your room (we are from the east coast so daylight comes a little after 5am) The bed was not the most comfortable and It is close to the highway so lots of road noise and I was startled out of a sleep in the middle of the night. It is close to the mall so if that is important, you can walk to it.
reviews.title: Great staff, fantasic room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My suggestion would be to look for a place more central to the wharf area and not so close to the highway and make sure to ask if there is AC in the room, can't imagine staying there in the summer!
reviews.title: It exceeded expectations in a very pleasant way!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed here on may 27th and had a king room with a fireplace. It also had a microwave, fridge, and coffee maker. It was fabulous newly remolded with hardwood floors and granite countertops. Had a homey feel. I slept so sound in the bed. We sat outside at the fire pit next to the pool and had drinks and snacks it was very relaxing. The breakfast was good and fully stocked at all times. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Michelle turned on the fire pit and patio heaters as soon as you asked. The is a shopping center across the street that you can walk to. Check in and out were quick. Would stay here again. Great location.
reviews.title: Great stay in a great place - would definitely come back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: All of the reviews I read prior to staying raved about the in-room fireplaces. It's true, the fireplaces are the topping on the cake. The room we stayed in was lovely, roomy, quiet and warm. All of the amenities were just right, including breakfast. The staff was very friendly and helpful. My only disappointment was that we weren't able to use the pool or open pit fireplace--the weather was just too cool when we visited. While the Inn is not on the water, it was in a convenient location; although we had a car, which did make it easier to get around. A lovely stay, and I'd recommend it to friends and family.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, good value for money.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were very roomy and comfortable. I loved the decor and the fireplace. The location was also ideal with a shopping mall right across the street. Would stay there again.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay in Monterey

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We really enjoyed our stay -- nice clean pool, clean linens, quiet.
reviews.title: quite happy! aquarium package is great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went on the aquarium package -- it includes 2 adult tickets to the aquarium for 2 days -- so nice to be able to see the aquarium in 2 days instead of squishing it all in a day. (Especially true if you have young children who get tired of walking.)
reviews.title: Helpful staff, clean rooms, just as advertised !!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: The wife and I just enjoyed a fantastic weekend in Monterey and staying at the Mariposa Inn just made it better. We stayed in a King Suite with a fireplace . After a full day of sight seeing and driving around , a hot clean shower and a peaceful fire to sit by was just what was needed. The front desk staff gave us great directions to several great restaurants and always with a free map and a smile. We will definitely be back !
reviews.title: What a great spot in Monterey!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had heard great things about the Mariposa Inn and Suites and chose to stay there when I needed to be in Monterey. The rooms were beautifully appointed and spacious. I loved the fireplace and jacuzzi tub! The pool and grounds were lovely. I enjoyed my complimentary breakfast which I took back to my room. It is in a fabulous location right across from the Del Monte Shopping Center that has lots of great shopping and dining. I will highly recommend it to my colleagues, friends and family!
reviews.title: Would love to make this my go-to hotel in Monterey.
